title: Create a remote desktop connection
content:
A remote desktop connection is a useful tool to connect one Windows computer to another Windows computer.

To allow users to generate a remote desktop connection from Service Management, from the main menu, select Build > Service Asset & Configuration, and select the Enable RDP check box. When you select this option, Service Management displays a Remote Connection button at the top of each form.

Example:

As a user, you might want to troubleshoot a device associated with an incident. From Service Asset and Configuration Management, you can locate the device record. If the device is a networked Windows device, Service Management enables you to connect to it.

  1. From the main menu, select Build > Service Asset & Configuration.

  2. From SACM Home, select Devices.

  3. Search for the device record.

    To filter the record list, click the Add filter  button. For more information, see Filters.

  4. Click the record identifier in the ID column to display the selected record.

  5. Click Remote Connection on the toolbar.

    The Remote Connection button isn't available if the device displayed in the selected record isn't a Windows computer.

  6. Select an available connection.

    Connections can appear as a Name, DNS Name, or an IP address.
